{{NCAATeamSeason |Mode=Basketball |Year=1979â80 |Prev year=1978â79 |Next year=1980â81 |Team=Iowa Hawkeyes |Image= |Conference=Big Ten Conference |Division= |ShortConference=Big Ten |CoachRank= |APRank= |Record=23â10 |ConfRecord=10â8 |HeadCoach=[[Lute Olson]] |AsstCoach1= |AsstCoach2= |AsstCoach3= |StadiumArena=[[Iowa Field House]] |Champion= |BowlTourney=Final Four vs. Purdue |BowlTourneyResult=L 75â58 }} The '''1979â80 Iowa Hawkeyes men's basketball team''' represents the [[University of Iowa]] in the 1979â80 [[college basketball]] season. The team is led by head coach [[Lute Olson]]. They finished with a 20â8 (10â8 Big Ten) record the previous season. In the NCAA Tournament Iowa was in the East bracket. On the weekend of December 22/23 1979 Iowa played in the Dayton, Ohio Classic. ==Roster== {{Bt start}} {{Bt player|no=52|nat=United States|pos=F|pos2=|year=Jr|name=Steve Waite}} {{Bt player|no=32|nat=United States|pos=F|pos2=|year=Jr|name=Vince Brookins}} {{Bt player|no=54|nat=United States|pos=C|pos2=|year=Jr|name=Steve Krafcisin}} {{Bt player|no=34|nat=United States|pos=G|pos2=|year=So|name=Kevin Boyle}} {{Bt player|no=30|nat=United States|pos=G|pos2=|year=So|name=Kenny Arnold}} {{Bt player|no=12|nat=United States|pos=G|pos2=|year=Sr|name=[[Ronnie Lester]]}} {{Bt player|no=24|nat=United States|pos=G|pos2=|year=Fr|name=[[Bob Hansen]]}} {{Bt player|no=44|nat=United States|pos=F|pos2=|year=Fr|name=Mark Gannon}} {{Bt end}} ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable" | colspan="8" |
